docs.name: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program Participation and Costs
docs.description: As of Oct. 1, 2008, Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) is the new name for the federal Food Stamp Program.

docs.name: Cost of Food Distribution Programs
docs.description: Millions of $. Nutrition Services Incentive Program (NSIP--formerly Nutrition Program for the Elderly), Food Distribution on Indian Reservations (FDPIR), Commodity Supplemental Food (CSFP), Emergency Food Assistance (TEFAP).

docs.name: B.C. Seafood Production
docs.description: Landings/Harvest: The round (whole) weight of the fish harvested from British Columbia capture fisheries and aquaculture operations. One tonne equals 2,204.6 pounds. Landed Value: The price paid to the commercial fishers and/or aquaculturists for the whole fish. In aquaculture this can also be referred to as farmgate value. Wholesale Value: The value of the fish post processing. All of the British Columbia harvest is included in the wholesale value as well as any fish imported from outside British Columbia that has undergone significant processing within the province.

docs.name: B.C. Seafood Landings by Type
docs.description: Landings/Harvest: The round (whole) weight of the fish harvested from British Columbia capture fisheries and aquaculture operations. One tonne equals 2,204.6 pounds. Landed Value: The price paid to the commercial fishers and/or aquaculturists for the whole fish. In aquaculture this can also be referred to as farmgate value. Wholesale Value: The value of the fish post processing. All of the British Columbia harvest is included in the wholesale value as well as any fish imported from outside British Columbia that has undergone significant processing within the province.

docs.name: B.C. Seafood Landed Value by Type
docs.description: $ Millions. Landings/Harvest: The round (whole) weight of the fish harvested from British Columbia capture fisheries and aquaculture operations. One tonne equals 2,204.6 pounds. Landed Value: The price paid to the commercial fishers and/or aquaculturists for the whole fish. In aquaculture this can also be referred to as farmgate value. Wholesale Value: The value of the fish post processing. All of the British Columbia harvest is included in the wholesale value as well as any fish imported from outside British Columbia that has undergone significant processing within the province.

docs.name: Platinum Supply Sources and Demand
docs.description: 1000`s ounces. Supplies are estimates of sales by the mines of primary platinum group metals. Movements in stocks in a given year reflect changes in stocks held by fabricators, dealers, banks and depositories but excluding stocks held by primary refiners and final consumers. A positive figure indicates an increase in stocks; a negative figure indicates a rundown in stocks.

docs.name: Rhodium Supply Sources and Demand
docs.description: 1000`s ounces. Supplies are estimates of sales by the mines of primary platinum group metals. Movements in stocks in a given year reflect changes in stocks held by fabricators, dealers, banks and depositories but excluding stocks held by primary refiners and final consumers. A positive figure indicates an increase in stocks; a negative figure indicates a rundown in stocks.

docs.name: Palladium Supply Sources and Demand
docs.description: 1000`s ounces. Supplies are estimates of sales by the mines of primary platinum group metals. Movements in stocks in a given year reflect changes in stocks held by fabricators, dealers, banks and depositories but excluding stocks held by primary refiners and final consumers. A positive figure indicates an increase in stocks; a negative figure indicates a rundown in stocks.

docs.name: Humanity's Ecological Footprint and Biocapacity Through Time
docs.description: Global Hectares Per Capita. Global Footprint Network`s 2010 Edition National Accounts provide comprehensive new data on humanity`s pressure on resources and how it relates to the planet`s capacity to meet these demands.

docs.name: Deforestation of Brazil
docs.description: These figures are calculated from estimates provided by the Brazilian National Institute of Space Research (INPE) and the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). The figures only refer to the Brazilian Amazon, which accounts for roughly 60 percent of the Amazon rainforest.

docs.name: Population and Labor Force in Mexico
docs.description: Population includes Mexican citizens and foreign nationals normally residing in the country; Mexicans serving abroad in the diplomatic corps and their family members; and Mexican citizens who reside in Mexico and cross the border daily to work in another country. Data do not include foreign nationals serving in diplomatic missions in Mexico or their family members.

docs.name: Population and Labor Force in United States
docs.description: Population totals include resident population only.  All years are based on a July 1 (midyear) estimate, except 1990 and 2000, years that are Decennial Census counts based on an April 1 estimate.

docs.name: Greenhouse Gas Emmissions by Transportation Sector in Mexico
docs.description: Thousands of metric tons of CO2 Equivalents. Road is a combination of data for passenger cars, light-duty trucks and other trucks. Emissions in this sector come from the consumption of Gasoline, Diesel, LPG and natural gas. Air refers to domestic aviation. Domestic aviation emissions come from the consumption of jet fuel and gasoline. Emissions from international aviation transport (also known as international bunker fuel emissions) are excluded from national totals. Rail transport emissions consist only of diesel consumption. Marine refers to domestic marine. Domestic marine emissions come from the consumption of diesel and fuel oil. Emissions from international maritime transport (also known as international bunker fuel emissions) are excluded from national totals.

docs.name: IRS Business Returns, Receipts, Income, and Deficits
docs.description: Money amount in 000s. This data contains statistics on all businesses, which were compiled to form the SOI Integrated Business Dataset (IBD). The IBD was assembled at the table level from the annual SOI cross-sectional studies of corporations. Data from these annual statistical studies are generally publicly available and are published in a variety of SOI reports.

docs.name: Individual Income Tax Returns and Income (Constant 2005 $)
docs.description: Data from 1913-1981 are taken directly from Paris, David and Hilgert, Cecelia, "70th Year of Individual Income and Tax Statistics, 1913-1982", Statistics of Income Bulletin, Winter 1983-1984, Volume 3, Number 3.  Data for 1982-2005 are from Statistics of Income -- Individual Income Tax Returns (IRS Publication 1304), various years.

docs.name: Individual Income Tax Returns and Income (Current $)
docs.description: Data from 1913-1981 are taken directly from Paris, David and Hilgert, Cecelia, "70th Year of Individual Income and Tax Statistics, 1913-1982", Statistics of Income Bulletin, Winter 1983-1984, Volume 3, Number 3.  Data for 1982-2005 are from Statistics of Income -- Individual Income Tax Returns (IRS Publication 1304), various years.

docs.name: Per Capita Gross Domestic Product Based on Purchasing Power Parity in China, 1980-2010, with Projections to 2035
docs.description:
* Purchasing-power-parity (PPP) adjustment attempts to make currency among different countries comparable based on the amount of currency required to purchase the same volume of goods in each country. The IMF expresses PPP-adjusted figures in international dollars, a theoretical currency that corresponds to nominal U.S. dollars.
Note: Projected Chinese per capita GDP in 2035 is calculated by Earth Policy Institute, based on projected GDP growth of 8 percent annually.
Source: Compiled by Earth Policy Institute from International Monetary Fund, World Economic Outlook Database, at www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2011/01/weodata/index.aspx, updated April 2011;  U.N. Population Division, World Population Prospects: The 2010 Revision Population Database, at esa.un.org/unpd/wpp/unpp, updated 3 May 2011.
column_names: Per Capita GDP (U.S. Dollars (PPP Adjusted, Current Year)*)

docs.name: Gross World Product, 1950-2009
docs.description:
Source: Data reproduced with permission from The Conference Board, Inc. Â© 2010 The Conference Board, Inc.
This is part of a supporting dataset for Lester R. Brown, World on the Edge: How to Prevent Environmental and Economic Collapse (New York: W.W. Norton & Company, 2011). For more information and a free download of the book, see Earth Policy Institute on-line at www.earth-policy.org.

docs.name: Gross Domestic Product Based on Purchasing Power Parity for China, India, and Brazil, 1980-2009
docs.description:
* Note: Purchasing-power-parity (PPP) adjustment attempts to make currency among different countries comparable based on the amount of currency required to purchase the same volume of goods in each country. The IMF expresses PPP-adjusted figures in international dollars, a theoretical currency that corresponds to nominal U.S. dollars.
Source: Compiled by Earth Policy Institute from International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Economic Outlook 2010, electronic database, at www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/weo/2010/02/weodata/index.aspx, updated October 2010.
This is part of a supporting dataset for Lester R. Brown, World on the Edge: How to Prevent Environmental and Economic Collapse (New York: W.W. Norton & Company, 2011). For more information and a free download of the book, see Earth Policy Institute on-line at www.earth-policy.org.
column_names: China (Billion U.S. Dollars (PPP Adjusted, Current Year)*)
India (Billion U.S. Dollars (PPP Adjusted, Current Year)*)
Brazil (Billion U.S. Dollars (PPP Adjusted, Current Year)*)

docs.name: Residential Energy Use in Canada by Need
docs.description: Energy use by end-need. Units are in PetJoules (PJ), which is equal to 10 power of 15 joules. 210 PJ is equivalent to about 50 megatons of TNT. This is the amount of energy released by the Tsar Bomba, the largest man-made nuclear explosion ever.

docs.name: Residential Energy Use in Canada by Source
docs.description: Energy use by source. Units are in PetJoules (PJ), which is equal to 10 power of 15 joules. 210 PJ is equivalent to about 50 megatons of TNT. This is the amount of energy released by the Tsar Bomba, the largest man-made nuclear explosion ever.

docs.name: Commercial Energy Use in Canada by Source
docs.description: Energy use by source. Units are in PetJoules (PJ), which is equal to 10 power of 15 joules. 210 PJ is equivalent to about 50 megatons of TNT. This is the amount of energy released by the Tsar Bomba, the largest man-made nuclear explosion ever.

docs.name: Stock Market Confidence Indices - Japan Crash Index Data
docs.description: The Investor Behavior Project at Yale University, under the direction of Dr. Robert Shiller since its beginning and now under the auspices of the Yale International Center for Finance, has been collecting questionnaire survey data on the behavior of US investors since 1984. Among the studies that this project has produced was a major study of investor thinking on the day of the stock market crash of 1987. As part of this project, regular questionnaire investor attitude surveys have been done continuously since 1989. The following reports on some stock market confidence indexes derived from this survey data. These indexes have a span of nearly twelve years, and thus are the longest-running effort to measure investor confidence and related investor attitudes.

docs.name: Stock Market Confidence Indices - Japan Valuation Index Data
docs.description: The Investor Behavior Project at Yale University, under the direction of Dr. Robert Shiller since its beginning and now under the auspices of the Yale International Center for Finance, has been collecting questionnaire survey data on the behavior of US investors since 1984. As part of this project, regular questionnaire investor attitude surveys have been done continuously since 1989. The following reports on some stock market confidence indexes derived from this survey data. These indexes have a span of nearly twelve years, and thus are the longest-running effort to measure investor confidence and related investor attitudes.
